page.title: 01Rawreth Area
page.content: Our area,which lies between Rayleigh and Wickford,consists mainly of arable farmland.In the centre is the village of Rawreth,a community divided by the A130 which runs from Chelmsford to Southend.Rawreth is an old settlement, although probably post 1086 as it is not mentioned in the original Doomsday Book.Plotland development in the early 20th century has given Rawreth its fragmented character.In the North,on the River Crouch,Battlesbridge is well known locally for its antique shops and stalls.To the West new housing at Shotgate is encroaching on the farmland,whilst to the East the Rawreth Industrial Estate is being developed.To the South are many ugly, but necessary electricity pylons. Interesting buildings include old cottages at Battlesbridge,Rawreth Church and thatched cottages.
